intro: Sisymbrium paradisum, commonly known as sweet rocket, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with serrated leaves and a distinctive musty scent. Its flowers, which range from white to purple, bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Sisymbrium paradisum is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
